New Records: This is the first time since 1968 that England have lost their final match before a major international tournament.
Key Match Events: Thorsteinsson scored the only goal of the game in the 12th minute.
John Stones was taken off at half-time after an opponent fell on the back of his ankle.
Alexander-Arnold nearly scored from nothing in the 90+4 minute, firing a shot that took a slight deflection and nearly found the inside of the far post.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate emphasized the importance of being better without the ball and showing more composure with the ball.
Southgate mentioned that many players needed the game to manage their minutes and get back into the rhythm of playing.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate spoke about taking some positives from the match despite the result, mentioning that the team learned a lot and needed the game.
Declan Rice mentioned that there were positive performances but also highlighted the need for improvement before the next game.
Anthony Gordon spoke about the importance of learning to break down teams that play defensively against England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A young Iceland fan was shown holding up the 1-0 scoreline with his fingers while grinning wide from ear to ear.
England outshot Iceland 13 to eight, but Iceland recorded four shots on goal to just one for the hosts.
Others: England will fly to Germany on June 10 for Euro 2024.
England's first game at Euro 2024 is against Serbia on June 16.
